translated: The perception of the emptiness of nonthings is dualistic.🔽The perception of the emptiness of essential nature is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi 'dus shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi 'dus shes ni /
translated: “The notion of the emptiness of essential nature of non-things is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // mngon par shes pa drug gi 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // mngon par shes pa drug gi 'du shes ni /
translated: “The notion of the six superknowledges is dualistic.

original: gnyis so; ;ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so; ;ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi 'du shes ni /
translated: “The notion of all the meditative stabilizations is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // gzungs kyi sgo thams cad kyi 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // gzungs kyi sgo thams cad kyi 'du shes ni /
translated: “The notion of all the dhāraṇī gateways is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs kyi 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs kyi 'du shes ni /
translated: “The notion of the powers of the tathāgatas is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // mi 'jigs pa'i 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // mi 'jigs pa'i 'du shes ni /
translated: “The notion of fearlessness is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // so so yang dag par rig pa'i 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // so so yang dag par rig pa'i 'du shes ni /
translated: “The notion of the correct understandings is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i 'du shes ni /
translated: “The notion of the distinct attributes of the Buddha is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // byams pa chen po'i 'du @347a *//🔽shes ni; gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyis so // byams pa chen po'i 'du @347a *// shes ni; gnyis so //
translated: “The notion of great love is dualistic.

original: snying rje chen po'i 'du shes ni /🔽gnyis so // rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i 'du shes ni /🔽gnyis so // lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i 'du shes ni /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i 'du shes ni / gnyis so // rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i 'du shes ni / gnyis so // lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i 'du shes ni /
translated: “The notion of great compassion is dualistic.🔽“The notion of the result of stream enterer is dualistic.🔽“The notion of the result of once-returner is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i 'du shes ni /
translated: “The notion of the result of non-returner is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'du shes ni /
translated: The notion of arhatship is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // rang byang chub kyi 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // rang byang chub kyi 'du shes ni /
translated: The notion of a pratyekabuddha is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'du shes ni /
translated: The notion of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'du shes ni /
translated: The notion of stream enterer is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'du shes ni /🔽gnyis so // phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'du shes ni / gnyis so // phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'du shes ni /
translated: The notion of once-returner is dualistic.🔽The notion of non-returner is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // dgra bcom pa'i 'du shes ni /🔽gnyis so // rang sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // dgra bcom pa'i 'du shes ni / gnyis so // rang sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes ni /
translated: The notion of arhat is dualistic.🔽The notion of pratyekabuddha is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes ni /
translated: The notion of buddha is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // 'dus byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // 'dus byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes ni /
translated: The notion of the compounded element is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gnyis so // 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes ni /
translated: The notion of the uncompounded element is dualistic.

original: gnyis so // rab 'byor /
analyzed: gnyis so // rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: de ltar de snyed du 'du shes dang bcas pa thams cad dang / ji snyed du 'du shes med pa de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: de ltar de snyed du 'du shes dang bcas pa thams cad dang / ji snyed du 'du shes med pa de dag thams cad ni /
translated: all those with notions, and all those without notions,

original: gnyis te / ji tsam du gnyis pa de tsam du dngos po'o //
analyzed: gnyis te / ji tsam du gnyis pa de tsam du dngos po'o //
translated: There are two, and to the extent that there are two, there are things.

original: ji tsam du dngos po yod pa de tsam du 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du dngos po yod pa de tsam du 'khor ba'o //
translated: To the extent that there are things, there is samsara.

original: ji tsam du 'khor ba de tsam du sems can rnams skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su @347b mi 'grol lo //
analyzed: ji tsam du 'khor ba de tsam du sems can rnams skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su @347b mi 'grol lo //
translated: To the extent that there is samsara, there is no liberation of sentient beings from birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation.

original: 'du shes thams cad yid la mi byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'du shes thams cad yid la mi byed pa ni /
translated: The non-attention to all perceptions is

original: gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: non-duality.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar gnyis kyi 'du shes can la sbyin pa med pa dang / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la tshul khrims med pa dang / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la bzod pa med pa dang / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la brtson 'grus med pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar gnyis kyi 'du shes can la sbyin pa med pa dang / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la tshul khrims med pa dang / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la bzod pa med pa dang / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la brtson 'grus med pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, by this one of many explanations it is like this: for those with the perception of two there is no generosity, for those with the perception of two there is no morality, for those with the perception of two there is no patience, for those with the perception of two there is no effort,

original: gnyis kyi 'du shes can la bsam gtan med pa dang / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la shes rab med pa dang / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la lam med pa dang / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la 'thob pa med pa dang / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la mngon par rtogs pa med par rig par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la ni /
analyzed: gnyis kyi 'du shes can la bsam gtan med pa dang / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la shes rab med pa dang / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la lam med pa dang / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la 'thob pa med pa dang / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la mngon par rtogs pa med par rig par bya'o // rab 'byor / gnyis kyi 'du shes can la ni /
translated: and those who have the notion of duality do not have clear realization.🔽Subhūti,

original: chung du na mthun pa'i bzod pa'ang med na /
analyzed: chung du na mthun pa'i bzod pa'ang med na /
translated: those who have the notion of duality do not even have the patience that is in accordance with reality,

original: gzugs yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /🔽tshor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: gzugs yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod / tshor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: so how could they know form?🔽so how could they know feeling?🔽so how could they know conception?

original: 'du shes yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /🔽'du byed yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: 'du shes yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod / 'du byed yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: so how could they know volitional factors?

original: rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: so how could they know consciousness?

original: mig yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: mig yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: so how could they know the eyes?

original: rna ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /🔽sna yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rna ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod / sna yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could the ear be cognized?🔽how could the nose be cognized?

original: lce yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: lce yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could the tongue be cognized?

original: lus yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: lus yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could the body be cognized?

original: yid yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la @348a *//
analyzed: yid yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la @348a *//
translated: how could the mind be cognized?

original: yod; gzugs yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: yod; gzugs yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could sights be cognized?

original: sgra yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /🔽dri yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /🔽ro yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: sgra yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod / dri yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod / ro yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could sounds be cognized?🔽how could smells be cognized?🔽how could tastes be cognized?

original: reg yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: reg yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could touches be cognized?

original: chos yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /🔽mig gi rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: chos yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod / mig gi rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could mental phenomena be cognized?🔽how could eye consciousness be cognized?

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could ear consciousness be cognized?

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod; lce'i rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod; lce'i rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the nose consciousness? How could they understand the tongue consciousness?

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the body consciousness?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the mind consciousness?

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /🔽rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /🔽sna'i 'dus te reg pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod / sna'i 'dus te reg pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand eye contact?🔽How could they understand ear contact?🔽How could they understand nose contact?

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand tongue contact?

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand body contact?

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand mind contact?

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la @348b yod; rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la @348b yod; rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact? How could they understand the feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact?

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the feeling that arises from the condition of nose contact?

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the feeling that arises from the condition of tongue contact?

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the feeling that arises from the condition of body contact?

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the feeling that arises from the condition of mind contact?

original: sa'i khams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: sa'i khams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the earth element?

original: chu'i khams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: chu'i khams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the water element?

original: me'i khams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: me'i khams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the fire element?

original: rlung gi khams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rlung gi khams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the element of wind?

original: nam mkha'i khams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the element of space?

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the element of consciousness?

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand dependent origination?

original: ma rig pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: ma rig pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand ignorance?

original: 'du byed yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: 'du byed yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand volitional factors?

original: rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand consciousness?

original: ming dang gzugs yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand name and form?

original: skye mched drug yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: skye mched drug yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the six sense sources?

original: reg pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /🔽tshor ba @349a *//
analyzed: reg pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod / tshor ba @349a *//
translated: How could they understand contact?

original: yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand feeling?

original: sred pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: sred pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand craving?

original: len pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: len pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they understand appropriation?

original: srid pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: srid pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they understand existence?

original: skye ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: skye ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they understand birth?

original: rga shi yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /🔽blang ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rga shi yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod / blang ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they understand old age and death?🔽how could they understand taking up?

original: dor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: dor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they understand giving up?

original: bsam gtan dang po yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they understand the first concentration?

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they understand the second concentration?

original: bsam gtan gsum pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /🔽bsam gtan bzhi pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta  yod; byams pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod / bsam gtan bzhi pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta  yod; byams pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they understand the third concentration?🔽how could they understand the fourth concentration?🔽how could they understand love?

original: snying rje yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: snying rje yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they understand compassion?

original: dga' ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: dga' ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: how could they understand joy?

original: btang snyoms yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: btang snyoms yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they fully understand equanimity?

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they fully understand the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space?

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they fully understand the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness?

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su shes par @349b 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su shes par @349b 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they fully understand the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing whatsoever?

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /

analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /

original: chos rjes su dran pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: chos rjes su dran pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they fully understand the recollection of the Dharma?

original: dge 'dun rjes su dran pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: dge 'dun rjes su dran pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /

original: tshul khrims rjes su dran pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: tshul khrims rjes su dran pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the recollection of morality?

original: gtong ba rjes su dran pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: gtong ba rjes su dran pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /

original: lha rjes su dran pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /

analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /

analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyang ga la yod /

analyzed: rang byang chub kyang ga la yod /

analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'ang ga la yod / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: How could they have the abandonment of all afflictions with their residues?

original: le'u lnga bcu dgu pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u lnga bcu dgu pa'o ////
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, Chapter Fifty-Nine.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: gal te de ltar dngos po'i 'du shes can la mthun pa'i bzod pa'ang ma mchis pas /
analyzed: gal te de ltar dngos po'i 'du shes can la mthun pa'i bzod pa'ang ma mchis pas /
translated: If it is like that, if one has the notion of a thing, one does not have the acquiescence that is in accordance with reality,

original: 'thob pa lta ga la mchis te /
analyzed: 'thob pa lta ga la mchis te /
translated: so how could one attain it?

original: ma mchis / mngon par rtogs pa lta'ang ga la mchis te /
analyzed: ma mchis / mngon par rtogs pa lta'ang ga la mchis te /
translated: If one does not have it, how could one realize it?

original: ma mchis na /
analyzed: ma mchis na /
translated: If one does not have it,

original: ci lags / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: ci lags / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: dngos po ma mchis pa'i 'du shes can la mthun pa'i bzod pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i 'du shes can la mthun pa'i bzod pa'am /
translated: is it that one who has the notion of a non-thing has the acquiescence that is in accordance with reality,

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa 'am /
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa 'am /
translated: the ground of seeing the light,

original: rigs kyi sa'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi sa'am /
translated: the ground of the lineage,

original: brgyad pa'i sa'am /
analyzed: brgyad pa'i sa'am /
translated: the eighth ground,

original: mthong ba'i sa'am /
analyzed: mthong ba'i sa'am /
translated: the ground of seeing,

original: bsrabs pa'i sa'am /
analyzed: bsrabs pa'i sa'am /
translated: the ground of thinning out,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa'am /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa'am /
translated: the ground of separation from desire,

original: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa'am /
analyzed: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa'am /
translated: the ground of the one who has done,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'am /
translated: the pratyekabuddha ground,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'am /
translated: the bodhisattva ground,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'am /
translated: the buddha ground,

original: lam sgom pa @353a *//
analyzed: lam sgom pa @353a *//
translated: or the cultivation of the path?

original: gang la brten cing /
analyzed: gang la brten cing /
translated: What is it that one relies on?

original: nyon mongs pa gang gis bsgribs pas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang gis bsgribs pas /
translated: What is the afflictive obstruction?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par chud par mi 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par ma chud pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par chud par mi 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par ma chud pas /
translated: and without entering into the secure state of a bodhisattva,🔽they will not attain the knowledge of all aspects;

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob pas /🔽bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi spongs pa'i sgrib pa nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob pas / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi spongs pa'i sgrib pa nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
translated: and without attaining the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag spong bar 'gyur ba'i lam mchis sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag spong bar 'gyur ba'i lam mchis sam /
translated: they will not eliminate all the afflicted mental states that are the compulsive residues of the mental afflictions, and they will not eliminate the mental afflictions that are associated with the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha vehicles.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos skye bar 'gyur ba gang yang skye ba mchis na /
analyzed: gal te chos skye bar 'gyur ba gang yang skye ba mchis na /
translated: if there is any phenomenon that arises,

original: ji ltar chos de dag ma skyed par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar chos de dag ma skyed par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur /
translated: how could one attain the knowledge of all aspects without having produced those phenomena?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One replied,🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la mthun pa'i bzod pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la mthun pa'i bzod pa med do //
translated: There is no stage of acquiescence in conformity for those who have the notion of non-entityness.

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la mngon par rtogs pa'i sa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la mngon par rtogs pa'i sa med do //
translated: There is no stage of clear realization for those who have the notion of non-entityness.

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa med do //
translated: There is no stage of seeing white dharmas for those who have the notion of non-entityness.

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la rigs kyi sa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la rigs kyi sa med do //
translated: There is no stage of lineage for those who have the notion of non-entityness.

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la brgyad pa'i sa med do //🔽dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la mthong ba'i sa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la brgyad pa'i sa med do // dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la mthong ba'i sa med do //
translated: There is no eighth stage for those who have the notion of non-entityness.🔽There is no stage of seeing for those who have the notion of non-entityness.

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la bsrabs pa'i sa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la bsrabs pa'i sa med do //
translated: There is no stage of thinning for those who have the notion of non-entityness.

original: @353b dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa med do //
analyzed: @353b dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa med do //
translated: There is no stage of separation from desire for those who have the notion of non-entityness.

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la byas pa rtogs pa'i sa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la byas pa rtogs pa'i sa med do //
translated: There is no stage of realizing what is to be done for those who have the notion of non-entityness.

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la rang sangs rgyas kyi sa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la rang sangs rgyas kyi sa med do //
translated: There is no pratyekabuddha stage for those who have the notion of non-entityness.

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la byang chub sems dpa'i sa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la byang chub sems dpa'i sa med do //
translated: “Those who have the notion of non-entity do not have the bodhisattva stages.

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la sangs rgyas kyi sa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la sangs rgyas kyi sa med do //
translated: Those who have the notion of non-entity do not have the buddha stage.

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la lam bsgom pa gang la brten cing /🔽nyon mongs pa gang gis bsgribs pas /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la lam bsgom pa gang la brten cing / nyon mongs pa gang gis bsgribs pas /
translated: Those who have the notion of non-entity do not have the path of meditation on which they rely.🔽And those who have the notion of non-entity do not have the afflictions that obscure them.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud par mi 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par ma chud pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud par mi 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par ma chud pas /
translated: Those who have the notion of non-entity do not enter into the secure state of bodhisattvas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob pas /🔽bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi spong ba'i sgrib pa nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob pas / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi spong ba'i sgrib pa nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
translated: And those who have the notion of non-entity do not attain the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Those who have the notion of non-entity do not have the path on which they rely in order to eliminate all the afflictions that are the latent afflictions.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag spang bar 'gyur ba'i lam med do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag spang bar 'gyur ba'i lam med do //
translated: And those who have the notion of non-entity do not have the afflictions of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas that are eliminated.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti then said, “Lord,

original: ci lags / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe dngos po mchis par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po mchis par 'du shes pa mchis sam /
analyzed: ci lags / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe dngos po mchis par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po mchis par 'du shes pa mchis sam /
translated: “Is it that the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom have the idea of an existent thing, or do they have the idea of a nonexistent thing?”🔽“They have the idea of form, they have the idea of feeling, they have the idea of perception, they have the idea of volitional factors, they have the idea of consciousness, they have the idea of eyes, they have the idea of ears,🔽they have the idea of nose, they have the idea of tongue, they have the idea of body, they have the idea of thinking mind, they have the idea of form, they have the idea of sound, they have the idea of smell, they have the idea of taste,🔽they have the idea of tangibles, they have the idea of dharmas, they have the idea of an eye constituent, they have the idea of a form constituent, they have the idea of an eye consciousness constituent,

original: gzugs su 'du shes pa dang / tshor bar 'du shes pa dang / 'du shes su 'du shes pa dang / 'du byed du 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / mig tu 'du shes pa dang / rna bar 'du shes @354a *//
analyzed: gzugs su 'du shes pa dang / tshor bar 'du shes pa dang / 'du shes su 'du shes pa dang / 'du byed du 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / mig tu 'du shes pa dang / rna bar 'du shes @354a *//
translated: they have the idea of an ear constituent, they have the idea of a sound constituent, they have the idea of an ear consciousness constituent,🔽they have the idea of a nose constituent, they have the idea of a smell constituent, they have the idea of a nose consciousness constituent,🔽they have the idea of a tongue constituent, they have the idea of a taste constituent, they have the idea of a tongue consciousness constituent,🔽they have the idea of a body constituent, they have the idea of a tangible constituent, they have the idea of a body consciousness constituent,

original: pa dang / snar 'du shes pa dang / lcer 'du shes pa dang / lus su 'du shes pa dang / yid du 'du shes pa dang / gzugs su 'du shes pa dang / sgrar 'du shes pa dang / drir 'du shes pa dang / ror 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: pa dang / snar 'du shes pa dang / lcer 'du shes pa dang / lus su 'du shes pa dang / yid du 'du shes pa dang / gzugs su 'du shes pa dang / sgrar 'du shes pa dang / drir 'du shes pa dang / ror 'du shes pa dang /
translated: they have the idea of a thinking-mind constituent, they have the idea of a dharma constituent, they have the idea of a thinking-mind consciousness constituent,🔽they have the idea of a perfection, they have the idea of emptiness, they have the idea of a patience, they have the idea of a concentration, they have the idea of a meditative absorption, they have the idea of a meditative stabilization, they have the idea of a formless absorption, they have the idea of a superknowledge, they have the idea of a dhāraṇī gateway, they have the idea of a power, they have the idea of a fearlessness, they have the idea of a quality exclusive to a buddha, they have the idea of a great love, they have the idea of a great compassion, they have the idea of a pratyakabuddha, they have the idea of a pratyakabuddha’s disciples, they have the idea of a pratyakabuddha’s disciples’

original: reg tu 'du shes pa dang / chos su 'du shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang /🔽lus kyi rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg par 'du shes pa dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg par 'du shes pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg par 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: reg tu 'du shes pa dang / chos su 'du shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg par 'du shes pa dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg par 'du shes pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg par 'du shes pa dang /
translated: the perception of the nose, the perception of smells, the perception of the nose consciousness, the perception of the body, the perception of tactile objects, the perception of the body consciousness, the perception of the mental faculty, the perception of phenomena, the perception of the mind consciousness, the perception of eye contact, the perception of ear contact, the perception of nose contact,

original: lce'i 'dus te reg par 'du shes pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg par 'du shes pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg par 'du shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes pa dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg par 'du shes pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg par 'du shes pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg par 'du shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes pa dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes pa dang /
translated: the perception of tongue contact, the perception of body contact, the perception of mental contact, the perception of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact, the perception of the feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact,

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes pa dang /
translated: They are the perception of the feeling that arises from the condition of the union of the eye faculty and form, the perception of the feeling that arises from the condition of the union of the ear faculty and sound, the perception of the feeling that arises from the condition of the union of the nose faculty and smell, the perception of the feeling that arises from the condition of the union of the tongue faculty and taste, the perception of the feeling that arises from the condition of the union of the body faculty and touch, and the perception of the feeling that arises from the condition of the union of the mind faculty and mental phenomena.

original: sa'i khams su 'du @354b shes pa dang / chu'i khams su 'du shes pa dang / me'i khams su 'du shes pa dang / rlung gi khams su 'du shes pa dang / nam mkha'i khams su 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams su 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: sa'i khams su 'du @354b shes pa dang / chu'i khams su 'du shes pa dang / me'i khams su 'du shes pa dang / rlung gi khams su 'du shes pa dang / nam mkha'i khams su 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams su 'du shes pa dang /
translated: They are the perception of the earth element, the perception of the water element, the perception of the fire element, the perception of the wind element, the perception of the space element, and the perception of the consciousness element.

original: 'dod chags su 'du shes pa dang / 'dod chags spong bar 'du shes pa dang / zhe sdang du 'du shes pa dang / zhe sdang spang bar 'du shes pa dang / gti mug tu 'du shes pa dang / gti mug spang bar 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags su 'du shes pa dang / 'dod chags spong bar 'du shes pa dang / zhe sdang du 'du shes pa dang / zhe sdang spang bar 'du shes pa dang / gti mug tu 'du shes pa dang / gti mug spang bar 'du shes pa dang /
translated: They are the perception of desire, the perception of the abandonment of desire, the perception of anger, the perception of the abandonment of anger, the perception of ignorance, and the perception of the abandonment of ignorance.

original: ma rig par 'du shes pa dang / ma rig pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / 'du byed du 'du shes pa dang / 'du byed spang bar 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: ma rig par 'du shes pa dang / ma rig pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / 'du byed du 'du shes pa dang / 'du byed spang bar 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang /
translated: They are the perception of ignorance, the perception of the abandonment of ignorance, the perception of conditioning, the perception of the abandonment of conditioning, the perception of consciousness, the perception of the abandonment of consciousness,

original: ming dang gzugs su 'du shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs spang bar 'du shes pa dang / skye mched drug tu 'du shes pa dang / skye mched drug spang bar 'du shes pa dang / reg par 'du shes pa dang / reg pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs su 'du shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs spang bar 'du shes pa dang / skye mched drug tu 'du shes pa dang / skye mched drug spang bar 'du shes pa dang / reg par 'du shes pa dang / reg pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang /
translated: the perception of name and form, the perception of the abandonment of name and form, the perception of the six sense sources, the perception of the abandonment of the six sense sources, the perception of contact, the perception of the abandonment of contact,

original: tshor bar 'du shes pa dang / tshor ba spang bar 'du shes pa dang / sred par 'du shes pa dang / sred pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / len par 'du shes pa dang / len pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / srid par 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: tshor bar 'du shes pa dang / tshor ba spang bar 'du shes pa dang / sred par 'du shes pa dang / sred pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / len par 'du shes pa dang / len pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / srid par 'du shes pa dang /
translated: the perception of sensation, the perception of the abandonment of sensation, the perception of craving, the perception of the abandonment of craving, the perception of grasping, the perception of the abandonment of grasping, the perception of becoming,

original: srid pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / skye bar 'du shes pa dang / skye ba spang bar 'du shes pa dang / rga shir 'du shes pa dang / rga shi spang bar 'du shes pa dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don par 'du shes pa dang /🔽mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa spang bar 'du @355a *//
analyzed: srid pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / skye bar 'du shes pa dang / skye ba spang bar 'du shes pa dang / rga shir 'du shes pa dang / rga shi spang bar 'du shes pa dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don par 'du shes pa dang / mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa spang bar 'du @355a *//
translated: the perception of existence, the perception of birth, the perception of the abandonment of birth, the perception of old age and death, the perception of the abandonment of old age and death, the perception of sorrow,

original: shes pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde bar 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba spang bar 'du shes pa dang / 'khrug par 'du shes pa dang / 'khrug pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal du 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: shes pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde bar 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba spang bar 'du shes pa dang / 'khrug par 'du shes pa dang / 'khrug pa spang bar 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal du 'du shes pa dang /
translated: the perception of the abandonment of sorrow and lamentation, the perception of suffering and mental unease, the perception of the abandonment of suffering and mental unease, the perception of disturbance, the perception of the abandonment of disturbance, the perception of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal kun shes par bya bar 'du shes pa dang / kun 'byung bar 'du shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spang bar 'du shes pa dang / 'gog par 'du shes pa dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya bar 'du shes pa dang / lam du 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun shes par bya bar 'du shes pa dang / kun 'byung bar 'du shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spang bar 'du shes pa dang / 'gog par 'du shes pa dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya bar 'du shes pa dang / lam du 'du shes pa dang /
translated: the perception of the origin of suffering, the perception of the abandonment of the origin of suffering, the perception of cessation, the perception of the realization of cessation, the perception of the path,

original: lam bsgom par 'du shes pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar 'du shes pa'i bar du mchis sam /
analyzed: lam bsgom par 'du shes pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar 'du shes pa'i bar du mchis sam /
translated: the perception of the cultivation of the path, the perception of the knowledge of all aspects, up to the perception of the abandonment of all afflictions that are connections to traces.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni /
translated: “Subhūti,🔽it does not.

original: med do // rab 'byor /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: med do // rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Subhūti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos gang la'ang dngos po yod par 'du shes pa'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos gang la'ang dngos po yod par 'du shes pa'am /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they do not perceive any phenomenon as existent or

original: dngos po med par 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med par 'du shes pa med do //
translated: nonexistent.

original: gang la dngos po yod par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po med par 'du shes pa de nyid ni /
analyzed: gang la dngos po yod par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po med par 'du shes pa de nyid ni /
translated: The perception of things as existent and the perception of things as nonexistent are

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: the patient acceptance that accords with reality.

original: gang la dngos po yod par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po med par 'du shes pa med pa de nyid ni /
analyzed: gang la dngos po yod par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po med par 'du shes pa med pa de nyid ni /
translated: The absence of the perception of things as existent and the perception of things as nonexistent is

original: lam sgom pa'o //
analyzed: lam sgom pa'o //
translated: the cultivation of the path.🔽The absence of the perception of things as existent and the perception of things as nonexistent is

original: gang la dngos po yod par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po med par 'du shes pa med pa de @355b nyid ni; 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gang la dngos po yod par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po med par 'du shes pa med pa de @355b nyid ni; 'bras bu'o //
translated: the result.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam ni /
translated: Subhūti, the path of the bodhisattva great beings

original: dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ste /
translated: is not a thing.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'ang dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'ang dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The clear realization is also not a thing.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar chos thams cad ni /
translated: Subhūti, in this way, by this formulation, you should know that all phenomena

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: are the essence of a nonthing.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: gal te da ltar chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
analyzed: gal te da ltar chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
translated: If all phenomena are essentially unreal,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur te /
translated: how is it that the Thus-Gone One has fully awakened to the fact that all phenomena are essentially unreal?

original: de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
analyzed: de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
translated: Since he has fully awakened to this fact,

original: chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i yul la mnga' brnyes par gyur /
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i yul la mnga' brnyes par gyur /
translated: he has gained mastery over the domain of all phenomena.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to; ;rab 'byor /
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: 'di la nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing /
analyzed: 'di la nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing /
translated: “Su­bhūti, in the past, when I was practicing the conduct of the bodhisattvas

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe 'dod pas dben /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe 'dod pas dben /
translated: and engaging in the practice of the six transcendent perfections, I was free from desire,

original: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa /🔽rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa / rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: free from evil and nonvirtuous factors,

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: and endowed with ideation and scrutiny.

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar bzhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar bzhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: He dwells having attained the first concentration, which is accompanied by investigation and sustained thought, and is born of seclusion and filled with joy and bliss.

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas /🔽rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar @356a *//
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas / rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar @356a *//
translated: Having abandoned investigation and sustained thought,🔽he dwells having attained the second concentration, which is born of concentration and is filled with joy and bliss, and is unified mind.

original: bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas /
analyzed: bsgrubs te gnas so // dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas /
translated: He dwells having attained the third concentration, which is born of concentration and is filled with bliss, and is without joy.🔽He dwells having attained the fourth concentration, which is without pain and without pleasure, and is purified in terms of equanimity and mindfulness.

original: dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms la gnas te /🔽bde ba lus kyis myong zhing /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms la gnas te / bde ba lus kyis myong zhing /
translated: He dwells having attained the sphere of infinite space, having completely transcended the sphere of infinite consciousness.🔽He dwells having attained the sphere of infinite consciousness, having completely transcended the sphere of infinite space.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la rnam par dpyod pa btang snyoms pa'o //🔽zhes brjod pa ste /🔽dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la rnam par dpyod pa btang snyoms pa'o // zhes brjod pa ste / dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having attained the sphere of nothingness, having completely transcended the sphere of infinite consciousness.🔽He dwells having attained the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, having completely transcended the sphere of nothingness.

original: bde ba'ang spangs /
analyzed: bde ba'ang spangs /
translated: He dwells having attained the cessation of perception and feeling, having completely transcended the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: sdug bsngal ba'ang spangs shing /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'ang spangs shing /
translated: I abandoned suffering

original: snga ma'i yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba'ang med /
analyzed: snga ma'i yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba'ang med /
translated: and, since I had previously abandoned mental pleasure and mental pain, I also abandoned pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal yang med pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang med pa /
translated: I also abandoned pain.

original: btang snyoms dang dran pas yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas par gyur te /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang dran pas yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas par gyur te /
translated: I attained and dwelled in the fourth meditative concentration, which is purified and endowed with equanimity and mindfulness.

original: 'on kyang ngas bsam gtan de dag dang / bsam gtan gyi yan lag de dag gi mtshan ma bzung ste bsam gtan de dag gis bsnyems par ma gyur /
analyzed: 'on kyang ngas bsam gtan de dag dang / bsam gtan gyi yan lag de dag gi mtshan ma bzung ste bsam gtan de dag gis bsnyems par ma gyur /
translated: However, I did not grasp at the signs of those meditative concentrations or the branches of those meditative concentrations, and I did not become arrogant because of those meditative concentrations.

original: bsam gtan gyi ro myong bar ma gyur /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi ro myong bar ma gyur /
translated: I did not experience the taste of those meditative concentrations.

original: bsam gtan du dmigs par ma gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan du dmigs par ma gyur te /
translated: I did not focus on those meditative concentrations.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In that way,

original: ngas bsam gtan de dag rnam pa yongs su dag pas mnyam par bzhag go //
analyzed: ngas bsam gtan de dag rnam pa yongs su dag pas mnyam par bzhag go //
translated: I entered meditative absorption with those meditative concentrations that were completely pure.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In that way,

original: ngas bsam gtan de dag rnam par smin par byas nas shes pa rnam pa tha dad pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir sems gzhol bar byas /
analyzed: ngas bsam gtan de dag rnam par smin par byas nas shes pa rnam pa tha dad pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir sems gzhol bar byas /
translated: I ripened those meditative concentrations and directed my mind to actualize the different kinds of knowledge.

original: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir sems gzhol bar byas /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir sems gzhol bar byas /
translated: I focused my mind on the knowledge of the divine ear.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir sems gzhol bar byas /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir sems gzhol bar byas /
translated: I focused my mind on the knowledge of the thoughts of others.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa @356b shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir sems gzhol bar byas /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa @356b shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir sems gzhol bar byas /
translated: I focused my mind on the knowledge of the recollection of former lives.

original: lha'i mig gi shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir sems gzhol bar byas /
analyzed: lha'i mig gi shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir sems gzhol bar byas /
translated: I focused my mind on the knowledge of the divine eye.

original: 'on kyang ngas mngon par shes pa mngon du bya ba de dag la mtshan mar bzung ste mngon par shes pa de dag gis shes par ma gyur /
analyzed: 'on kyang ngas mngon par shes pa mngon du bya ba de dag la mtshan mar bzung ste mngon par shes pa de dag gis shes par ma gyur /
translated: However, I did not apprehend the characteristics of those superknowledges, and I did not know them,

original: ro myong bar ma gyur /
analyzed: ro myong bar ma gyur /
translated: I did not experience them,

original: dmigs par ma gyur te /
analyzed: dmigs par ma gyur te /
translated: and I did not observe them.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga po de dag nam mkha' lta bur yang dag par rjes su dran pas mnyam par bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga po de dag nam mkha' lta bur yang dag par rjes su dran pas mnyam par bzhag pa ste /
translated: I was equipoised, recollecting the five superknowledges as being like space.

original: de ltar ngas skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'di ni /🔽sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de ltar ngas skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'di ni / sdug bsngal lo //
translated: In this way, I attained supreme perfect enlightenment through the wisdom of a single instant.🔽This is suffering.

original: 'di ni / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni / sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'o lam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'o lam mo //
translated: This is the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes par gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes par gyur te /
translated: I understood this to be the way things truly are.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang ldan par gyur /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang ldan par gyur /
translated: In this way, I attained the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ldan par gyur /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ldan par gyur /
translated: I attained the four forms of fearlessness.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang ldan par gyur /🔽byams pa chen po dang ldan par gyur /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang ldan par gyur / byams pa chen po dang ldan par gyur /
translated: I attained the four forms of unhindered knowledge.🔽I attained great love.

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan par gyur /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan par gyur /
translated: I attained great compassion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang ldan par gyur nas sems can rnams phung po gsum du lung bstan par gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang ldan par gyur nas sems can rnams phung po gsum du lung bstan par gyur to //
translated: and endowed with the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, he prophesied the three groups of beings.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis @357a *//
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis @357a *//
translated: how did the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One

original: dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bsam gtan bzhi bskyed par gyur /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bsam gtan bzhi bskyed par gyur /
translated: generate the four concentrations that have the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature as their nature?

original: ji ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mngon par shes pa drug mngon par mkhyen pa bskyed par gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mngon par shes pa drug mngon par mkhyen pa bskyed par gyur /
translated: How did he generate the six superknowledges that have the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature as their nature?

original: ji ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bskyed par gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bskyed par gyur /
translated: How did he generate the ten powers of the tathāgata that have the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature as their nature?

original: ji ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mi 'jigs pa bzhi bskyed par gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mi 'jigs pa bzhi bskyed par gyur /
translated: How did he generate the four fearlessnesses that have the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature as their nature?

original: ji ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi bskyed par gyur /🔽ji ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi byams pa chen po bskyed par gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi bskyed par gyur / ji ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi byams pa chen po bskyed par gyur /
translated: How did they give rise to the four detailed and thorough knowledges whose nature is not a real existent?🔽How did they give rise to great love whose nature is not a real existent?

original: ji ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi snying rje chen po bskyed par gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi snying rje chen po bskyed par gyur /
translated: How did they give rise to great compassion whose nature is not a real existent?

original: ji ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bskyed par gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bskyed par gyur /
translated: How did they give rise to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha whose nature is not a real existent?

original: sems can rnams kyang sems can ma mchis par ji ltar phung po gsum du lung bstan par gyur /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang sems can ma mchis par ji ltar phung po gsum du lung bstan par gyur /
translated: And how did they prophesy sentient beings as having three groups of sentient beings whose nature is not a real existent?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / gal te 'dod pa rnams dang / sdig to mi dge ba'i chos rnams la dngos po zhig yod de /🔽ngo bo nyid yod pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te 'dod pa rnams dang / sdig to mi dge ba'i chos rnams la dngos po zhig yod de / ngo bo nyid yod pa'am /
translated: “Subhūti, if the desire and the nonvirtuous misdeeds were a real existent,🔽had an intrinsic nature,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po zhig yod na ni /
translated: or were something else,

original: rab 'byor / ngas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe 'dod pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / sdig to mi dge ba'i chos rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig gnas bsam gtan bzhi nye bar bsgrubs te gnas @357b par yang mi 'gyur te /🔽rab 'byor / 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams dang / sdig to mi dge ba'i chos rnams la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa gzhan gyi dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe 'dod pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / sdig to mi dge ba'i chos rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig gnas bsam gtan bzhi nye bar bsgrubs te gnas @357b par yang mi 'gyur te / rab 'byor / 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams dang / sdig to mi dge ba'i chos rnams la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa gzhan gyi dngos po med pa ste /
translated: The Lord: If the Bodhisattva, when he courses in perfect wisdom, does not review form, etc.

original: gzhan du na /
analyzed: gzhan du na /
translated: to: the knowledge of all modes, then he reviews the perfection of giving, etc.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: to: the knowledge of all modes.

original: rab 'byor / de'i phyir nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe 'dod pas dben sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa'i rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'i phyir nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe 'dod pas dben sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa'i rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: Subhuti: If the Bodhisattva, when he courses in perfect wisdom, does not review the perfection of giving, etc.🔽to: the knowledge of all modes, how then does he review the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc.

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: to: the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha?🔽The Lord: If the Bodhisattva, when he courses in perfect wisdom, does not review the perfection of giving, etc.🔽to: the knowledge of all modes, then he reviews the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc.🔽to: the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha.

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas par gyur to //
translated: He attained and dwelled in the first concentration, which is free from the desires and free from evil and unwholesome states, which is endowed with ideation and scrutiny, and is born of solitude and is filled with rapture and joy.🔽

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par spyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /🔽sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par spyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste / sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas /
translated: He then entered and dwelled in the first concentration, which is endowed with applied and sustained thought, and is born of seclusion and joy and bliss.

original: rtog pa med pa spyod pa med pa ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas par gyur to; ;dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms la gnas te /🔽bde la lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis dran pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa spyod pa med pa ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas par gyur to; ;dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms la gnas te / bde la lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis dran pa dang ldan pa /
translated: Then, with the stilling of applied and sustained thought, he entered and dwelled in the second concentration, which has an inner serenity that is born of single-pointed focus and is endowed with the joy and bliss of single-pointedness, but is free of applied and sustained thought.

original: bde ba la rnam par spyod pa btang snyoms pa'o //🔽zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba la rnam par spyod pa btang snyoms pa'o // zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: Then, with the fading away of joy, he dwelled in equanimity, mindful and discerning, and experienced within himself that bliss of which the noble ones say, “Equanimous and mindful, one dwells in bliss.

original: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas par gyur to //
translated: ” He then entered and dwelled in the third concentration, which is without joy.

original: bde ba'ang spangs /sdug bsngal yang spangs shing /
analyzed: bde ba'ang spangs /sdug bsngal yang spangs shing /
translated: He abandoned pleasure, abandoned pain,

original: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas /
analyzed: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas /
translated: and previously abandoned mental pleasure and mental pain.

original: bde ba'ang med /
analyzed: bde ba'ang med /
translated: He did not have pleasure,🔽and he did not have pain,

original: sdug bsngal yang med pa btang snyoms dang / dran pas yongs su dag pa'i bsam @358a *//
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang med pa btang snyoms dang / dran pas yongs su dag pa'i bsam @358a *//
translated: but he was endowed with equanimity and mindfulness,

original: gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas par gyur to //
translated: and he achieved and remained in the fourth concentration.

original: rab 'byor / gal te mngon par shes pa rnams la dngos po zhig yod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te mngon par shes pa rnams la dngos po zhig yod de /
translated: Subhūti, if the superknowledges had a thing,

original: ngo bo nyid yod pa'am /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod pa'am /
translated: had an intrinsic nature,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po zhig yod na ni /
translated: or had another thing,

original: rab 'byor / ngas kyang mngon par shes pa thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas kyang mngon par shes pa thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Subhūti, I would not have known that all the superknowledges have the intrinsic identity of a non-thing, and I would not have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar mngon par shes pa rnams la dngos po med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar mngon par shes pa rnams la dngos po med de /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the superknowledges do not have a thing,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa /
translated: do not have an intrinsic nature,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po med pa ste /
translated: and do not have another thing,

original: gzhan du na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan du na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: Otherwise, since it would be the nature of a non-entity,

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis mngon par shes pa thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du thugs su chud de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par🔽sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis mngon par shes pa thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du thugs su chud de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: therefore the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, having understood all the superknowledges to be the nature of non-entities, fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid la bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lngas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid la bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lngas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya na /
translated: if it is like that, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening through the four concentrations and five superknowledges in the nature of non-entityness of all phenomena,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ci'i slad du /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du /
translated: why is it so?

original: chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
translated: In the nature of non-entityness of all phenomena,

original: byang chub sems @358b dpa' sems dpa' chen po mthar gyis spyod pa dang / mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis nan tan du bgyi ba gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i mthar gyis spyod pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems @358b dpa' sems dpa' chen po mthar gyis spyod pa dang / mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis nan tan du bgyi ba gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i mthar gyis spyod pa dang /
translated: “There is a gradual practice, a gradual training, and a gradual application that bodhisattva great beings should practice in order to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis nan tan du bgyi ba mchis par gyur /
analyzed: mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis nan tan du bgyi ba mchis par gyur /
translated: “Blessed One, is there a gradual practice, a gradual training, and a gradual application that bodhisattva great beings should practice in order to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos thog mar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur ba'i dgra bcom pa dag dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos thog mar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur ba'i dgra bcom pa dag dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang /
translated: “Subhūti, it is because bodhisattva great beings first serve the blessed buddhas, the bodhisattva great beings, the worthy ones who have served many buddhas,🔽the non-returners,🔽the once-returners,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dag las /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dag las /
translated: and the stream enterers.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: The Bhagavān buddhas are the non-entity nature, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas are the non-entity nature, the pratyekabuddhas are the non-entity nature, the arhats are the non-entity nature,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / 'phags pa thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / 'phags pa thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: the non-returners are the non-entity nature, the once-returners are the non-entity nature, the stream enterers are the non-entity nature, all the āryas are the non-entity nature,

original: 'du byed rnams kyi ngo bo nyid chung du na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyi gnas tsam yang med do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi ngo bo nyid chung du na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyi gnas tsam yang med do //
translated: and the entities of compounded phenomena are not even as much as the part of a hair tip.

original: zhes bya bar thos na /
analyzed: zhes bya bar thos na /
translated: When they hear this,

original: byang chub sems @359a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems @359a *//
translated: the bodhisattvas

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ci ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ci ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid /
translated: Why is it that the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, are also the nature of nonentity?🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid /🔽rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid /
translated: “If the bodhisattva great beings are also essentially nonexistent,🔽the buddhas, the blessed ones, are also essentially nonexistent,

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid /🔽phyir mi 'ong ba rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid /
translated: the solitary buddhas are also essentially nonexistent,🔽the worthy ones are also essentially nonexistent,🔽the nonreturners are also essentially nonexistent,
